summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, regarding the indictment and impending arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It details immediate operational plans, including deploying agents to Florida and preparing to execute a search warrant at his New York residence upon his return to the U.S., as he is believed to be in France.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; indicted in SDNY with a warrant sworn out for his arrest. Believed to be in France at the time.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The sender/forwarder of the email, coordinating the squad's response to Epstein's indictment and planning arrest and investigative operations.

connections.description: The FBI agent is organizing the operational response to arrest Epstein and execute related search warrants following his indictment.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Plans Arrest and Investigation
events.description: The FBI squad is placed on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

locations: NYC (New York City, presumably Epstein's residence)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, with an arrest warrant issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plans included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.
The email indicates the investigation required the entire FBI squad, with assistance from other units, and sought availability from agents through the holiday weekend and the following week.
